author: Dave S
comment: Don't bother if u run a HTC, not worth the hassle. No big deal as I forecast no snow for 2014, no widget required.  Upon install widget was automatically placed on home screen, from there it continues to prompt me 2 place it on homescreen. WTF

reply.author: coreForm
reply.content: You're likely mistaking the App Shortcut for a Widget. Please take some time to read the instructions that are displayed when you press the App Shortcut, it'll show you how to add a Widget to your homescreen. If you could let me know which HTC device you are using that'll help.

title: Doesn't work on a HTC

author: Robert Kennedy
comment: SnowCell is great. Works well on my galaxy note 2. Since it is an Australia-only widget, would you consider a adding an off-season "temporary disable" option so I can stop it auto-updating itself until next winter without having to uninstall it...?
title: Winter funfacts...

author: Nicholas Phipps
comment: Everything you need for planning your snowfield adventures!

author: Onz Brau
comment: Thanks for fixing the twitter feed issue. Only problem is you can't configure the widget to display just the info your interested in.

reply.author: coreForm
reply.content: At the moment the finest granularity of data is per snow resort, you can select which ones you want to see. Today's update fixes a bug where some screens/data was getting skipped.

title: Configure options

author: Pier Federici
comment: Now it's up to nature to provide the white stuff.
title: Brilliant

author: Brad Harrington
comment: The app looks the goods. Has everything you would want... EXCEPT you can't get the f/ing thing to work. Won't install properly. I have an S3 and have tried four times. Still won't work. Potential is there. Just needs fixing. Stuck on twitter which I don't care about

reply.author: coreForm
reply.content:
Update: Hi there, I would appreciate it greatly if you would update your review subsequent to the fix regarding Twitter.

Twitter turned off their old API, hence the failure, I've dusted off old code and released an update.

title: Rubbish

author: Wayne Williamson
comment: Won't even start up as stalks trying to initialise twitter feed,  which is not really necessary anyway.  Can't rate an app that doesn't work.

reply.author: coreForm
reply.content: Twitter turned off their old API, hence the failure, I've dusted off old code and released an update.

title: Wont load

author: Tim Millhouse
comment: Been looking for an app like this since I first strapped on a board. Make the type bigger and I'd give you 6.
title: Bloody Awesome

author: Nihal Mirpuri
comment: This is excellent! It even works flawlessly on my super old android 2.1 device. Argh it's making me want to go skiing now!
title: Beautiful widget!

author: Ivan Simmonds
comment: I wish I had read the reviews first. This app is the worst app I have ever downloaded. It never worked despite giving it 4 weeks in the snow season to get it right. I feel like I paid too much for this app at $0.00

reply.author: coreForm
reply.content:
Update: Hi there, I would appreciate it greatly if you would update your review subsequent to the fix regarding Twitter.

Twitter turned off their old API, hence the failure, I've dusted off old code and released an update. Hope it's worth the $0.00!

title: Worst ever

author: Carl Matthews
comment: i have a samsung galaxy s3 ... when i download this app it appears on the apps page and not in the widgets section ...  having moved the app to the opening page of the phone ... and having opened the app ... all i've ever seen is the information page :(

reply.author: coreForm
reply.content: That is a problem with Samsung's Launcher (native Android also suffers this bug), you should find the widget will show up once you have Force Closed the Launcher app or restart your phone. Sorry for the inconvenience, but please note: Google then Samsung did this. I'd appreciate it greatly if you could update your review to let me know how it went.

title: doesn't work!!!

author: A Google User
comment: Great results with this app... literally changed my life.
